column2: So  when  the Supreme  Court  has  considered  a question  of law and  refused  leave  on
question  under Article  138(1)  of the  Constitution.  The  very  terms  of Article  138(1)
place  an  embargo  and  prohibit  the
proceedings could be had on this application. One cannot but overemphasize the fact

column1: that there  has  to be  a finis  to litigation  and  the  boundaries of restitutio in  integrum

column2: are  not  so  extensive  as  to  accommodate  causes  which  have  run  their  course  and
exhausted themselves in the Supreme Court.
